meanings.definition: Deny oneself something; renounce or reject something desired or valuable.
meanings.sent1: She decided to abnegate her favorite dessert to stay healthy.
meanings.sent2: He had to abnegate his dream of becoming a musician to support his family.
meanings.sent3: The cat tried to abnegate eating the fish, but eventually gave in to temptation.
meanings.sent4: In order to succeed, sometimes you have to abnegate your fears and take risks.
meanings.sent5: The soldier's loyalty was so strong that he would abnegate his own safety for his comrades.

meanings.sent1: The country had to abnegate some of its territory in the peace treaty.
meanings.sent2: She was willing to abnegate her seat on the bus to an elderly lady.
meanings.sent3: The magician had to abnegate his favorite trick due to a mishap with his props.
meanings.sent4: Sometimes, in order to move forward, you have to abnegate your past mistakes.
meanings.sent5: The CEO had to abnegate some control to his team in order to foster innovation.
